column1: Kobuleti (Georgian: ქობულეთი [kʰɔbulɛtʰi]) is a town in Adjara
column3: situated on the eastern coast of the Black Sea. It is the seat of Kobuleti Municipality and a seaside resort
column4: visited annually by Georgians and many former Soviet Union residents. It is especially popular with Armenian tourists.

column1: The town is situated in the south-western part of Georgia
column2: i.e. the northern part of the Autonomous Republic of Ajara. It borders with Ozurgeti Region to the north. The Regional centre is Kobuleti City
column3: which stretches along the Black Sea shore.

column1: Kobuleti Region consists of one municipal
column2: two district and seventeen village councils. There are 48 villages in the region. Representatives of 24 different nationalities live together with Georgians in the region. Kobuleti is known with its traditions
column7: bright shining sun and warm sea. The unique sandy beach widely inclined to the sea is noted with its marvelous views beautified by sky-scraped endemic pine trees

column1: The Kintrishi and Tikeri reserve areas are unique with their bio-diversity. One can find rare flora in the Ispani marsh.The surrounding region has diverse soil: seashore lowland is rich in peatbog soil. There are alpine rocks in the highlands
column2: red soil is found in the hill areas. The mountainous area is good for subtropical species.

column1: Kobuleti has several rivers. The most important ones are the Kintrishi River
Kintrishi Protected Landscape and Kobuleti Managed Reserve are located in Kobuleti.
